official-title.#text:
To direct the Secretary of the Interior to establish
		  goals for an all-of-the-above energy production plan strategy on a 4-year basis
		  on all onshore Federal lands managed by the Department of the Interior and the
		  Forest Service.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced
			 the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Planning for American Energy Act of
			 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Onshore domestic
			 energy production strategic plan

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: as
, and by inserting after
the following:

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by redesignating

header.#text:
Quadrennial
				Strategic Federal Onshore Energy Production Strategy

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
(hereafter in
				this section referred to as
with regard to lands administered by the

, shall develop and publish every 4 years a Quadrennial Federal Onshore
				Energy Production Strategy. This Strategy shall direct Federal land energy
				development and department resource allocation in order to promote the energy
				and national security of the United States in accordance with

mission of promoting the multiple use of Federal lands as set
				forth in the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall consult with the

on the projected energy demands of the United States
				for the next 30-year period, and how energy derived from Federal onshore lands
				can put the United States on a trajectory to meet that demand during the next
				4-year period. The
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Administrator of the Energy
				Information Administration

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall consider how Federal lands will contribute
				to ensuring national energy security, with a goal for increasing energy
				independence and production, during the next 4-year period.

text.#text:
In developing this
				Strategy, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall determine a domestic strategic production objective for the development
				of energy resources from Federal onshore lands. Such objective shall be—

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and the

text.#text:
the best estimate,
				based upon commercial and scientific data, of the expected increase in domestic
				production of oil and natural gas from the Federal onshore mineral estate, with
				a focus on lands held by the

the best estimate,
				based upon commercial and scientific data, of the expected increase in domestic
				production of strategic and critical energy minerals from the Federal onshore
				mineral estate;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and the

text.#text:
the best estimate,
				based upon commercial and scientific data, of the expected increase in
				megawatts for electricity production from each of the following sources: wind,
				solar, biomass, hydropower, and geothermal energy produced on Federal lands
				administered by the

the best estimate, based upon commercial
				and scientific data, of the expected increase in domestic production of oil,
				natural gas, coal, and other renewable sources from tribal lands for any
				federally recognized Indian tribe that elects to participate in facilitating
				energy production on its lands; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and the

text.#text:
the best estimate, based upon commercial
				and scientific data, of the expected increase in production of helium on
				Federal lands administered by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall consult with the

regarding the methodology used to arrive at its estimates for purposes of this
				section.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Administrator of the Energy Information Administration

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
has the authority to expand
				the energy development plan to include other energy production technology
				sources or advancements in energy on Federal lands.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that federally recognized Indian tribes may elect to set their own
				production objectives as part of the Strategy under this section. The

shall work in cooperation with any federally recognized Indian tribe that
				elects to participate in achieving its own strategic energy objectives
				designated under this subsection.

text.#text: It is the sense of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall have all necessary authority to make determinations regarding
				which additional lands will be made available in order to meet the production
				objectives established by strategies under this section. The

shall
				also take all necessary actions to achieve these production objectives unless
				the

determines that it is not in the national security and economic
				interests of the United States to increase Federal domestic energy production
				and to further decrease dependence upon foreign sources of energy. In
				administering this section, the relevant

shall only consider leasing
				Federal lands available for leasing at the time the lease sale occurs.

text.#text: The relevant

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall solicit the input of affected States, federally recognized Indian tribes,
				local governments, and the public.

text.#text: In developing each strategy, the

header.#text:
State, federally
				recognized Indian tribes, local government, and public input

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall report annually to the
and the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Committee on Natural Resources of the
				House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
on the progress of meeting the production goals set forth in the
				strategy. The
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources of
				the Senate

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall identify in the report projections for production
				and capacity installations and any problems with leasing, permitting, siting,
				or production that will prevent meeting the goal. In addition, the

shall make suggestions to help meet any shortfalls in meeting the production
				goals.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
				complete a programmatic environmental impact statement. This programmatic
				environmental impact statement will be deemed sufficient to comply with all
				requirements under that Act for all necessary resource management and land use
				plans associated with the implementation of the strategy.

text.#text:
Not later than 12 months after the date of
				enactment of this section, in accordance with

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 102(2)(C) of the National
				Environmental Policy Act of 1969

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall submit it to the
and the

, together with any comments received from States, federally recognized
				Indian tribes, and local governments. Such submission shall indicate why any
				specific recommendation of a State, federally recognized Indian tribe, or local
				government was not accepted.

text.#text:
At least 60 days prior to publishing a proposed strategy
				under this section, the

term.#tail:
means those that
				are necessary for the Nation’s energy infrastructure including pipelines,
				refining capacity, electrical power generation and transmission, and renewable
				energy production and those that are necessary to support domestic
				manufacturing, including but not limited to, materials used in energy
				generation, production, and
				transportation.
